tags: the doctor who set seemed like so much fun during the dt era
...and I love the fact that lindsay duncan got to be an action hero
it helps give me hope for all women as they age in the acting industry
summary:
Behind the Scene of The Waters of Mars (Part 9)

  Excerpt from a TV and Satellite Week interview with Lindsay Duncan: What was...
caption:
Behind the Scene of The Waters of Mars (Part 9)

Excerpt from a TV and Satellite Week interview with Lindsay Duncan:

What was it like working with David Tennant?

I loved it and I really hope we will work together again. He’s the ultimate professional. He turned up with the highest energy of anyone on set and, irritatingly, knew his lines far better than I did. But you can tell from the humour he brings to the part that he is great fun to be around.

Did you enjoy the action scenes?

I loved them. A lot of actresses have got a bit of action woman secretly tucked away inside them. I also adored the costume because it was comfortable. I’ve done lots of period roles where you look good, but you’re in pain because of a corset biting into you.

Were there many stunts?

The closest I got was riding on the back of a robot called Gadget, holding on to David. It looks faster than it actually was, but it was still pretty fast and I really enjoyed that.

Thank you to anyone who shared set photos!

Other Waters of Mars behind-the-scenes posts: [one] [two] [three] [four] [five] [six] [seven] [eight]
Full list of behind-the-scenes posts:  [ here ]

summary: Oh my god if you've never heard the Doctor who audiobooks, oh boy you've been missing out. I just started listening to 10th...
body: Oh my god if you’ve never heard the Doctor who audiobooks, oh boy you’ve been missing out. I just started listening to 10th Doctor’s audiobook story “Pest Control” and aahhhh David Tennant’s Donna impersonation is so damn hilarious! Seriously, listen to the audio books!! I’m dyinggg

summary:
F'Art Friday, y'all!
I've been exploring fiber art as fine art as of late. This is a cross stitch portrait of the lovely Georgia...
body:
F'Art Friday, y'all!

I’ve been exploring fiber art as fine art as of late. This is a cross stitch portrait of the lovely Georgia Tennant (wife of David Tennant). Given as a gift to David at Rose City Comic Con last year.

summary: So I started to watch Takin over the Asylum. It's really cool because it's Scottish and you get to hear their accent. but the...
body:
So I started to watch Takin over the Asylum. It’s really cool because it’s Scottish and you get to hear their accent. but the reason I started watching it is because IT HAS BABY TENNANT!

And yes, his hair has always been glorious

summary:
David Tennant - Shakespeare Live! From the RSC1 (2016)  
 If we shadows have offended,
 
 Think but this,--and all is mended,--
...
caption:
David Tennant - Shakespeare Live! From the RSC1 (2016)

If we shadows have offended,
Think but this,–and all is mended,–
That you have but slumber’d here
While these visions did appear.
And this weak and idle theme,
No more yielding but a dream,
Gentles, do not reprehend;
If you pardon, we will mend.
And, as I am an honest Puck,
If we have unearned luck
Now to ‘scape the serpent’s tongue,
We will make amends ere long;
Else the Puck a liar call:
So, good night unto you all.
Give me your hands, if we be friends,
And Robin shall restore amends.

By William Shakespeare (1564–1616)

From “A Midsummer-Night’s Dream,” Act V. Scene 2
